Translation: 감정을 표현하는 것은 / 좋다 / 당신의 정신 건강에.
Question: {{c1::To express feelings is good for your mental health.}}
Choices: to / express / feelings / is / good / for / your mental health

Translation: 중요한 시험을 위해 벼락공부를 하는 것은 / 나쁜 생각인 것 같다!
Question: {{c1::Cramming for an important exam seems like a bad idea}}!
Choices: cramming / for / an important exam / seems / like / a bad idea

Translation: 여러분 자신의 에세이를 큰 소리로 읽는 것은 / 여러분이 오류를 찾도록 도와줄 수 있습니다.
Question: {{c1::To read your own essay aloud can help you find the errors.}}
Choices: to read / your own essay / aloud / can / help / you / find / the errors

Translation: 알지 못하는 것은 / 나쁘다. 알고 싶어 하지 않는 것은 / 더 나쁘다.
Question: {{c1::Not to know is bad. Not to wish to know is worse.}}
Choices: not / to know / is / bad. / not / to wish / to know / is / worse

Translation: 다른 사람의 관점을 이해하려고 노력하는 것은 / 좋은 습관이다 (인생에 있어서).
Question: {{c1::Trying to see the other person’s point of view is a good rule in life.}}
Choices: trying / to / see / the other person’s point of view / is / a good rule / in / life

Translation: 새로운 가능성을 찾는 것은 / 탐구심을 갖고 / 필수적이다 / 성공적이 되는 데.
Question: {{c1::Searching for new possibilities with an inquisitive mind is essential to be successful.}}
Choices: searching for / new possibilities / with / an inquisitive mind / is / essential / to / be / successful

Translation: 충분한 수면을 취하지 않는 것은 / 일반적인 원인이다 (다크서틀의(눈 밑)).
Question: {{c1::Not getting enough sleep is a common cause of dark circles under the eyes.}}
Choices: not getting / enough sleep / is / a common cause / of / dark circles / under / the eyes

Translation: 사람들의 이름을 기억하는 것은 / 첫 번째 단계이다 (관계 형성을 향한).
Question: {{c1::Remembering[To remember] people’s names is the first step towards relationship building.}}
Choices: remembering[to remember] / people’s names / is / the first step / towards / relationship building

Translation: 우리가 다른 사람들에 대해 궁금해하는 것은 // 자연스러운 일이다.
Question: {{c1::That we are curious about others is natural.}}
Choices: that / we / are / curious / about / others / is / natural

Translation: 네가 성공할 것인지 아닌지는 // 너의 의지에 달려 있다.
Question: {{c1::Whether you will succeed or not depends on your will.}}
Choices: whether / you / will / succeed or not / depends / on / your will

Translation: 언제 네안데르탈인이 멸종되었는지가 // 논의된다 / 이 학술지에서.
Question: {{c1::When Neanderthals went extinct is discussed in this academic journal.}}
Choices: when / Neanderthals / went / extinct / is / discussed / in / this academic journal

Translation: 당신이 어디에서 왔는지는 // 덜 중요하다 / 당신이 어디로 가고 있는지보다.
Question: {{c1::Where you come from is less important than where you’re going.}}
Choices: where / you / come from / is / less important / than / where / you / are going

Translation: 어떻게 당신이 당신의 상상력을 제어하고 사용하는지가 // 당신의 삶의 질에 영향을 미친다.
Question: {{c1::How you control and use your imagination affects the quality of your life.}}
Choices: how / you / control / and / use / your imagination / affects / the quality of your life

Translation: 제안을 할 때는, / 왜 당신이 당신의 목적을 달성하고 싶은지가 // 명확하고 논리적이어야 한 다.
Question: {{c1::In making a proposal, why you want to achieve your purpose should be clear and logical.}}
Choices: in making / a proposal / why / you / want to / achieve / your purpose / should / be / clear and logical

Translation: 기후가 어떻게 변해 왔는지는 // 매우 중요하다 / 현재의 지구온난화 추세를 가늠하는 데.
Question: {{c1::How climate has changed is vital to assess current global warming trends.}}
Choices: how / climate / has / changed / is / vital / to assess / current global warming trends

Translation: 당신이 부유한지 가난한지는 // 우리 우정에 영향을 미치지 않는다.
Question: {{c1::Whether you are rich or poor does not affect our friendship.}}
Choices: whether / you / are / rich or poor / does not / affect / our friendship

Translation: 누가 다음 대통령이 될지는 // 결정된다 / 유권자들에 의해.
Question: {{c1::Who will be the next president is determined by voters.}}
Choices: who / will / be / the next president / is / determined / by / voters

Translation: 누구의 아이디어가 채택될지는 // 기밀로 유지된다.
Question: {{c1::Whose idea will be adopted remains confidential.}}
Choices: whose / idea / will / be / adopted / remains / confidential

Translation: 무엇이 알츠하이머병을 유발하는지는 // 아직 정확히 알려지지 않았다.
Question: {{c1::What causes Alzheimer’s Disease is not exactly known yet.}}
Choices: what / causes / Alzheimer’s Disease / is / not / exactly / known / yet

Translation: 무엇이 높은 사회적 신분의 상징으로 여겨지는지는 // 문화마다 다를 것이다.
Question: {{c1::What is considered a status symbol will differ among cultures.}}
Choices: what / is / considered / a status symbol / will / differ / among / cultures

Translation: 우리가 무엇을 보는지는 // 주로 ~에 달려 있다 / 우리가 무엇을 찾는지에.
Question: {{c1::What we see depends mainly on what we look for.}}
Choices: what / we / see / depends mainly on / what / we look for

Translation: 그 영화에서, / 주인공이 누구와 결혼하는지가 // 관객들을 흥미롭게 한다.
Question: {{c1::In the movie, whom the main character marries interests the audience.}}
Choices: in the movie / whom / the main character / marries / interests / the audience

Translation: 무슨 대단한 일이 일어날지는 / 우리의 인생에서 // 모두 짐작만 할 뿐인 것[누구도 확실히는 모르는 것]이다.
Question: {{c1::What great thing will happen in our life is anybody’s guess.}}
Choices: what / great thing / will / happen / in / our life / is / anybody’s guess

Translation: 어느 도시가 다음 올림픽을 개최할지가 // 오늘 발표될 것이다.
Question: {{c1::Which city will host the next Olympic Games will be announced today.}}
Choices: which / city / will / host / the next Olympic Games / will / be / announced / today

Translation: 어느 친구들을 당신이 선택하는지는 // 당신의 인생에 중요한 영향을 미친다.
Question: {{c1::Which friends you choose has a major influence on your life.}}
Choices: which / friends / you / choose / has / a major influence / on / your life

Translation: (~은) 기쁨이다 / 누군가를 완전히 믿는 것은.
Question: {{c1::It’s a delight to trust somebody so completely.}}
Choices: it’s / a delight / to trust / somebody / so completely.

Translation: (~은) 진실이다 // 건강이 재산보다 위에 있다는 것은.
Question: {{c1::It is true that health is above wealth.}}
Choices: it / is / true / that / health / is / above / wealth.

Translation: (~은) 좋지 않다 / 똑같은 독서 속도를 이용하는 것은 / 여러 가지 다른 유형의 책을 다루기 위해.
Question: {{c1::It is not good to use the same reading speed to handle different types of books.}}
Choices: it / is / not good / to / use / the same reading speed / to / handle / different types of books.

Translation: (~은) 중요하다 / 기억하는 것은 // 좋은 결정을 내린다 해도 나쁜 결과를 초래할 수 있음을.
Question: {{c1::It’s important to remember that good decisions can still lead to bad outcomes.}}
Choices: it's / important / to / remember / that / good decisions / can / still lead / to bad outcomes.

Translation: (~은) 놀랄 일이 아니다 // 과도한 패스트푸드가 / 비만의 원인이 될 수 있다는 것은.
Question: {{c1::It’s no wonder that too much fast food can contribute to obesity.}}
Choices: it’s / no wonder / that / too much fast food / can / contribute / to / obesity.

Translation: 현재로서는, / (~은) 확실하지 않다 // 저 너머에(지구 밖 우주에) 외계인이 존재하는지는.
Question: {{c1::At this time, it is not certain whether there are aliens out there.}}
Choices: at this time, / it / is not / certain / whether / there / are / aliens / out there.

Translation: (~은) 물리학으로 설명될 수 있다 // 어떻게 비행기가 나는지는.
Question: {{c1::It can be explained by physics how an airplane flies.}}
Choices: it / can / be / explained / by / physics / how / an airplane / flies.

Translation: (~은) 미스터리이다 // 왜 그가 자리를 떠났는지는 / 갑자기.
Question: {{c1::It is a mystery why he left his seat all of a sudden.}}
Choices: it / is / a mystery / why / he / left / his seat / all of a sudden.

Translation: (~해도) 소용없다 / 엎질러진 우유를 두고서 울어도.
Question: {{c1::It is no use crying over spilt milk.}}
Choices: it / is / no use / crying / over / spilt milk.

Translation: (~하는 것은) 가치가 있다 / 우리의 생각에 도전하는 것은 / 새로운 태도를 만들어 내기 위해.
Question: {{c1::It is worth challenging our thinking to create a new attitude.}}
Choices: it / is / worth / challenging / our thinking / to / create / a new attitude.

Translation: (~은) 중요하다 / 학생들이 따라가는 것은 / 현대 디지털 트렌드에.
Question: {{c1::It is important for students to keep up with modern digital trends.}}
Choices: it / is / important / for / students / to / keep up with / modern digital trends.

Translation: 진정한 리더들은 공간을 만들어 준다 (다른 사람들이 빛날).
Question: {{c1::Real leaders make space for others to shine.}}
Choices: real leaders / make / space / for / others / to / shine.

Translation: (~은) 당연하다 / 단어들이 의미가 변하는 것은 / 시간이 흐름에 따라.
Question: {{c1::It is natural for words to change their meaning over time.}}
Choices: it / is / natural / for / words / to / change / their meaning / over time.

Translation: 보행자들이 기다리고 있다 / 신호가 바뀌기를 / 빨간불에서 초록불로.
Question: {{c1::The pedestrians are waiting for the lights to change from red to green.}}
Choices: the pedestrians / are waiting / for / the lights / to / change / from red to green.

Translation: (~이) 권고됩니다 / 우리 신입 사원들이 / 모든 부서에서 경험을 쌓는 것이.
Question: {{c1::It is recommended for our new employees to gain experience in all departments.}}
Choices: it / is / recommended / for / our new employees / to / gain / experience / in all departments.

Translation: 네가 조심성이 없었구나 / 우산을 또 잃어버리다니.
Question: {{c1::It was careless of you to lose your umbrella again.}}
Choices: it / was / careless / of / you / to / lose / your umbrella / again.

Translation: 너는 현명하구나 / 이메일 첨부 파일을 열지 않다니 (모르는 출처로부터 온).
Question: {{c1::It is wise of you not to open e-mail attachments from an unknown source.}}
Choices: it / is / wise / of / you / not to / open / e-mail attachments / from / an unknown source.

Translation: 나는 정말 고맙다 / 네가 내가 숙제하는 것을 도와줘서.
Question: {{c1::I really appreciate your helping me with my homework.}}
Choices: I / really / appreciate / your helping / me / with / my homework.

Translation: 창문으로 햇빛이 들었음에도 불구하고, / 공기는 차가웠다.
Question: {{c1::In spite of the sun shining through the window, the air was chilly.}}
Choices: in spite of / the sun / shining / through / the window, / the air / was chilly.

Translation: 사람들에게 작은 요구를 하는 것이 / 가능성을 증가시킬 수 있다 / 나중에 그들이 더 큰 요구 를 수락할.
Question: {{c1::Making a small request to people can increase the chances of their accepting a bigger request afterwards.}}
Choices: making / a small request / to / people / can / increase / the chances of / their accepting / a bigger request / afterwards.

Translation: 가능성은 거의 없다 / 내가 장학금을 받을 / 이번 학기에.
Question: {{c1::There is very little likelihood of my getting the scholarship this semester.}}
Choices: there / is / very little likelihood / of / my getting / the scholarship / this semester.

Translation: 피터가 다른 사람들에 대해 불평하는 것은 / 그의 상황을 더 안 좋게 만들기만 할 것이다.
Question: {{c1::Peter’s complaining about others will only make his situation worse.}}
Choices: peter’s complaining / about / others / will / only / make / his situation / worse.

Translation: 정책 입안자들은 명심해야 한다 / 잘 만들어진 계획이 잘못될 가능성을.
Question: {{c1::Policymakers should keep in mind the possibility of well-made plans going wrong.}}
Choices: policymakers / should / keep in mind / the possibility / of / well-made plans / going / wrong.

Translation: 눈이 내렸다 / 사하라 사막에 / 30분 동안 / 1979년 2월 18일에.
Question: {{c1::It snowed in the Sahara desert for 30 minutes on Feb. 18, 1979.}}
Choices: it / snowed / in / the Sahara desert / for / 30 minutes / on Feb. 18, 1979.

Translation: 여기서 얼마나 먼가요 / 가장 가까운 지하철역까지?
Question: {{c1::How far is it from here to the nearest subway station?}}
Choices: how / far / is / it / from here / to the nearest subway station?

Translation: 월요일 아침이다, // 그리고 긴 한 주가 있다 / 우리 앞에.
Question: {{c1::It’s Monday morning, and there’s a long week ahead of us.}}
Choices: it’s / Monday morning, / and / there’s / a long week / ahead of us.

Translation: 이 안이 정말 시끄럽다, // 그러니 조금만 더 크게 말해라.
Question: {{c1::It’s really noisy in here, so speak a little louder.}}
Choices: it’s / really / noisy / in here, / so / speak / a little louder.

Translation: 내게 긴 시간이 걸렸다 / 내 자신을 판단하지 않는 데 / 다른 사람의 시선을 통해.
Question: {{c1::It took me a long time not to judge myself through someone else’s eyes.}}
Choices: it / took / me / a long time / not / to judge / myself / through / someone else’s eyes.

Translation: ~인 것 같다 // 그 약이 그가 회복하는 데 도움이 된 것.
Question: {{c1::It seems that the medicine has helped him recover.}}
Choices: it / seems / that / the medicine / has / helped / him / recover.

Translation: ~인 것 같지는 않았다 // 그들이 친한 친구인 것.
Question: {{c1::It didn’t seem that they were close friends.}}
Choices: it / didn’t / seem / that / they / were / close friends.

Translation: ~인 것 같다 // 우리가 길을 잃은 것. 난 모르겠다 // 우리가 어디에 있는지.
Question: {{c1::It appears that we are lost. I don’t know where we are.}}
Choices: it / appears / that / we / are / lost. / I / don’t know / where / we / are.

Translation: 놀랍게도, / 우연히 ~했다 // 나는 수학에서 A를 받았다.
Question: {{c1::To my surprise, it happened that I got an A in math.}}
Choices: to my surprise, / it / happened / that / I / got / an A / in math.
